intro: Gouania smilacina, commonly known as the creeping gouania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet, shady environments such as marshes and along stream banks. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences and bloom in the summer months. Gouania smilacina is known for its ability to thrive in moist, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in the southeastern United States.
